org.sd.fsm.impl
Class GrammarImpl

java.lang.Object
  org.sd.fsm.impl.GrammarImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
Grammar
public class GrammarImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements Grammar

A grammar expressed as a pattern of tokens.

A grammar is defined by rules where the left hand side (lhs) part defines a token that can be substituted for the right hand side (rhs) sequence of tokens. Rules appear as:
lhs <- rhs

Special rhs tokens are:
x + == the token, x, can be repeated one or more times to match the rule.
x * == the token, x, can be repeated zero or more times to match the rule,
x ? == the token, x, can be optional to match the rule.
. == the token at this position can be considered a valid end.

Author:
Spence Koehler

findRules

java.util.List<GrammarImpl.RulePos> findRules(AbstractToken token)
Find all rules whose first RHS token matches the given token.

Returns:
a list of applicable rules or null if no rules apply.

findRules

java.util.List<GrammarImpl.RulePath> findRules(GrammarToken fromToken,
                                               AbstractToken toToken)
Find rules that lead from fromToken (lhs) to toToken, according to the first rhs token.

For example, rules of form a <- b, b <- c, c <- d are rules from 'a' to 'd'.

Parameters:
fromToken - the rule to start from (unlimited if null).
toToken - the rule to stop at (required to be non-null).
Returns:
null or a list of rule paths, where a rule path is a list (path) of rules from fromToken to toToken.
